q: Which file extension represents a Tableau Packaged Workbook that contains both the workbook and the data?
A .twb file contains the visual layout of your dashboard but not the actual data.
The _____ pane displays the fields from your data source, organized into Tables.
Match File Types:
In Tableau, which color represents Discrete fields?
Measures are typically quantitative numerical data, while Dimensions are qualitative categorical data.
Continuous fields create axes in the view and are represented by the color _____.
Rearrange Field Types:
Which shelf allows you to break down a view into a series of small multiples?
Double-clicking a measure automatically adds it to the view.
The _____ Card is where you drag fields to control properties like Color, Size, and Label.
Match Shelves:
Which panel suggests visualization types based on the fields selected?
A Dual Axis chart allows you to combine two measures on the same chart with different scales.
The _____ shelf is used to filter data across all worksheets using the same data source (if applied to all).
Rearrange Workflow:
Which connection type imports data into Tableau's high-performance data engine?
A Live connection updates automatically when the underlying database changes.
To combine data from different tables in the same data source, you can use a _____.
Match Connections:
What is the primary difference between a Dashboard and a Story?
o: A Story contains a sequence of views/dashboards; a Dashboard combines views on a single screen.
A Story is for printing; a Dashboard is for interactive use.
A Story is static; a Dashboard is dynamic.

q: You can add images and web pages to a Tableau Dashboard.
The _____ object in a dashboard allows you to arrange items horizontally or vertically.
Rearrange Hierarchy:
Which data type icon represents a Date field in Tableau?
The Globe icon indicates a geographic role (Latitude/Longitude).
The symbol '#' represents a _____ data type.
Match Icons:
What happens when you drag a Dimension to the Color mark?
o: It assigns a unique color to each member of the dimension.
It creates a gradient color scale.

q: Dragging a Measure to the Size mark changes the size of marks based on the measure's value.
To display values as text labels on the chart, drag the field to the _____ mark.
Rearrange Marks:
Which filter type allows the user to select values from a list in the dashboard?
Filters are executed in a specific order of operations in Tableau.
A _____ filter effectively creates a temporary table for the other filters to work on.
Match Filter Order:
Which chart type requires one Geographic dimension and one Measure?
A Bar chart typically compares categorical data.
A _____ chart shows data change over a continuous period of time.
Rearrange Date Drill:
Which function allows you to clean or reshape data before bringing it into the worksheet?
o: Data Interpreter / Pivot in Data Source Page

q: You can Split a column into multiple columns based on a delimiter in the Data Source page.
The _____ option is used to convert 'wide' data (many columns) to 'tall' data (many rows).
Match Data Prep:
Which aggregation is the default for a numerical measure when added to the view?
You can change the aggregation of a measure by right-clicking it in the view.
The _____ aggregation returns the number of unique values in a field.
Rearrange Aggregation:
What is the term for a user-defined field that is not in the original data source?
Calculated fields always calculate at the data source level.
To start writing a formula, select 'Create _____ Field' from the data pane menu.
Which feature allows you to group related members in a field (e.g., grouping 'CA', 'OR', 'WA' as 'West Coast')?
Groups can be created by selecting marks in the view and clicking the paperclip icon.
The _____ feature creates groupings of equal size intervals (e.g., Age 0-10, 11-20).
Match Grouping:
Which reference line type allows you to show the average value of the data in the view?
Reference lines can be applied to the entire table, per pane, or per cell.
The _____ Band allows you to shade the area between two reference lines.
Match Ref Scope:
Which sorting method sorts the data based on the values of a measure?
You can clear a sort by clicking the 'Clear Sort' icon in the toolbar.
To manually reorder headers in a view, you can simply _____ and drop them.
Rearrange Sorting:
Which dashboard action allows you to click on a mark to filter other views in the dashboard?
A Highlight Action creates a filter that removes unrelated data points.
The _____ Action allows you to open a web page from a dashboard.
Match Actions:
Which formatting option allows you to change the font size of the worksheet title?
You can add a border around a worksheet in a dashboard using the Layout pane.
The _____ Lines are gridlines that correspond to the axes.
Rearrange Format:
Which tooltip feature allows you to insert a visualization inside a tooltip?
Tooltips are static text only and cannot include dynamic field values.
The _____ button in the Tooltip editor allows you to add fields to the tooltip text.
Match Tooltip:
Which export option allows you to save a static image of your dashboard?
Exporting to PowerPoint creates a slide for each sheet/dashboard selected.
The _____ export option saves the underlying data to a CSV file.
Rearrange Export:
What is the function of the 'Pages' shelf?
o: Creates an animation or paginated view based on a field
Creates a new page in the workbook

q: The Pages shelf creates a slider that allows you to step through the members of a dimension.
The _____ checkbox on the Pages card allows you to leave a trail of marks as they move (history).
Match Animation:
Which join type returns only rows that have matching values in both tables?
A Left Join returns all rows from the left table and matching rows from the right table.
The _____ join returns all rows from both tables, joining where possible.
Rearrange Join:
Which data source filter applies before any other filters in the worksheet?
Extract Filters are applied when determining what data is stored in the extract.
The _____ filter creates a subset of data that improves performance for other dependent filters.
Match Priority:
Which annotation type allows you to add text to a specific point in the visualization?
Mark Annotations move with the mark if the data changes.
The _____ annotation selects an entire area of the view.
Rearrange Annotate:
Which specialized chart uses a line to show the range between minimum and maximum values?
A Box and Whisker Plot is used to show the distribution of a set of data.
The _____ chart displays the shape of a distribution (frequency of values).
Match Distribution:
Which set type allows the members to change dynamically based on a condition?
A Combined Set allows you to create a set from the union, intersection, or difference of two other sets.
The _____ members option allows you to manually select who is in the set.
Which calculation function returns the number of days between two dates?
DATETRUNC truncates a date to the specified accuracy (e.g., first day of the month).
The _____ function returns the current date and time.
Match Date Funcs:
Which logical function evaluates a condition and returns one value if true and another if false?
ZN() returns zero if the expression is null, otherwise it returns the expression.
The _____ function returns true if the expression is missing (null).
Rearrange Logic:
Which chart type displays data as filled areas on a map based on a geographic dimension?
A Symbol Map places a mark at the center of each geographic location.
The _____ Map allows you to disable panning and zooming.
Match Map Type:
Which string function finds the position of a substring within a string?
LEFT(String, 3) returns the last 3 characters of the string.
The _____ function removes leading and trailing whitespace.
Rearrange String:
Which type of calculation aggregates data at a specified level of detail?
FIXED LOD expressions calculate a value using the specified dimensions, regardless of the view's dimensions.
The _____ LOD includes the dimension in the calculation in addition to the view dimensions.
Match LOD:
Which join type creates a Cartesian product of two tables (every row matched with every row)?
Data Blending joins data from secondary sources on a common field within the visualization (left join behavior).
A _____ represents a link between two data sources in a Blend.
Rearrange Blend:
Which feature allows you to create a dynamic parameter that users can change?
Parameters are global variations that can be used in calculations, filters, and reference lines.
To use a parameter, you must show the _____ control.
Match Parameter:
Which chart type shows cumulative values over a period?
A Bump Chart is used to compare rank of categories over time.
The _____ chart displays part-to-whole contribution over time.
Rearrange Bump:
Which function converts a number to a string?
INT() converts a value to an integer by truncating decimals.
The _____ function converts a string to a specific date format.
Match Conversion:
Which map layer option removes the background map entirely?
You can connect to Web Map Services (WMS) to use custom background maps.
The _____ panel controls the visibility of map features like Coastline, Borders, and Streets.
Rearrange Layer:
Which table calculation computes the value relative to the previous value?
Quick Table Calculations allow you to create common table calcs without writing formulas.
The _____ calculation creates a cumulative sum.
Match Table Calc:
Which feature finds the optimal number of groups in your data automatically?
Trend Lines describe the relationship between two variables (Linear, Logarithmic, etc.).
The _____ pane contains analytic objects like reference lines, trend lines, and forecast.
Rearrange Analytics:
Which join type retains all records from the right table and matching from left?
A Union appends rows from one table to another (stacking them).
To perform a union on files with different names in the same folder, use a _____ union.
Which feature allows you to combine multiple measures into a single axis?
Dragging 'Measure Values' to the Rows shelf allows you to display multiple measures in the same chart.
The _____ field is automatically created to label the measures when Measure Values is used.
Match Axis Type:
Which logical function checks if a value creates an error?
o: ISERROR (Not standard, typically use ZN or IFNULL)
None (Use ZN to handle nulls, no direct try/catch in Calc Fields)

q: The IFNULL(expression1, expression2) function returns expression2 if expression1 is null.
The _____ function replaces null values with zero.
Rearrange Null Handle:
Which dashboard object allows users to navigate between dashboards using buttons?
You can customize the appearance of a Navigation Button with a custom image.
The _____ object allows you to show or hide a container by clicking a button.
Match Dash Object:
Which map feature allows you to group geographic fields into custom regions?
Creating a group from geographic selection creates a new geographic field (Custom Territory).
The _____ role allows you to map data using non-standard geographic codes (e.g., Airport Codes).
Rearrange Territory:
Which function allows you to perform aggregation on aggregate results?
You cannot standard aggregate an already aggregated field (e.g., SUM(SUM(Sales)) is invalid).
The _____ function sums values within a visual window.
Match Window Func:
Which feature allows you to define the relationship between multiple tables without flattening them?
Relationships automatically handle the aggregation level for each table (Context-aware).
The _____ layer is the physical layer where Joins and Unions happen.
Match Data Model:
Which formatting feature allows you to format lines based on the axis value (e.g., Grid lines)?
Zero Lines indicate where the axis value is zero.
The _____ lines show the structure of the data grid (Rows/Columns dividers).
Rearrange Lines:
Which extract feature allows you to limit the data imported by a date range?
You can aggregate data for visible dimensions when creating an extract to reduce file size.
The _____ refresh adds new rows to the extract without reloading the entire dataset.
Match Extract:
Which chart type creates a correlation matrix?
A Highlight Table uses color to encode value magnitude in a text table.
The _____ chart connects two measures with a line to show change (Dumbbell chart).
Rearrange Heatmap:
Which action allows you to change the value of a parameter by clicking on a mark?
Parameter actions enable interactivity like drill-down, sheet swapping, and dynamic reference lines.
The _____ Action allows you to highlight specific marks across views.
Match Interaction:
Which function returns the number of characters in a string?
UPPER() converts a string to all uppercase letters.
The _____ function replaces a substring with another string.
Rearrange Text:
Which visual mark type is used to create a Gantt chart?
To create the length of the Gantt bar, you drag a measure to the Size card.
The _____ mark type connects points in order.
Match Mark Type:
Which calculation function returns a unique identifier for each row?
INDEX() returns the index of the current row in the partition.
The _____ function returns the standard rank (1, 2, 2, 4 for ties).
Which data blending feature allows you to change the primary data source for a sheet?
o: Rebuilding the view with the new primary first

q: The primary data source is determined by the first field dragged into the view.
The _____ checkmark refers to the primary data source.
Match Blend Colors:
Which calculation computes the percentile of an expression within the partition?
PERCENTILE() is an aggregation function, while RANK_PERCENTILE() is a table calculation.
The _____ function returns the value at the specified percentile.
Rearrange Percentile:
Which dashboard layout option allows you to overlap floating objects?
Tiled objects automatically resize to fill the available space in the container.
The _____ layout tab allows you to set specific pixel positions for floating objects.
Match Dashboard:
Which feature helps you identify how your workbook performance is impacted?
Performance Recording creates a new workbook with dashboards showing query execution times.
The _____ Optimizer suggests best practices to improve workbook performance.
Rearrange Performance:
Which LOD expression allows you to compute a value at a coarser level of detail than the view?
EXCLUDE LOD expressions remove dimensions from the view level of detail for the calculation.
The _____ LOD is computed before dimension filters are applied.
Match LOD Scope:
Which function returns the maximum value in a list of expressions?
MAX([Date]) returns the latest date in the partition.
The _____ function returns the absolute value of a number.
Rearrange Max:
Which feature allows you to replace a data source with another one?
Replacing a data source maps fields with matching names automatically.
The _____ field allows you to fix broken references when fields have different names.
Match Source Ops:
Which chart type is best for showing the distribution of data across quartiles?
In a Box Plot, the box represents the Interquartile Range (IQR).
The whiskers in a box plot typically extend to 1.5 times the _____.
Rearrange Boxplot:
Which function converts a string date to a date format?
DATE('1/1/2023') converts the string literal to a date type.
The _____ function returns the year part of a date.
Match Date Conv:
Which feature allows you to join a table to itself?
Unioning a table to itself doubles the row count.
To perform a self-join, you drag the same _____ into the canvas twice.
Rearrange Self Join:
Which action allows you to update a parameter from a selection in a visual?
Set Actions allow you to change the members of a set by interacting with marks.
The _____ Action plays an animation or highlights data points.
Match Action Type:
Which calculation computes the running total of a measure?
LOOKUP(SUM(Sales), -1) retrieves the previous row's sales value.
The _____ function returns the difference between the current value and the lookup value.
Rearrange Prev Val:
Which mapping type allows you to connect points with lines (e.g., flight paths)?
To create a path map, you need a Path Order field to define the sequence of connection.
The _____ mark type line is used for path maps.
Which action allows you to drill down into a hierarchy by clicking a header?
You can drill down in a hierarchy by clicking the '+' symbol on the field header.
The _____ symbol indicates that a field can be expanded (drilled down).
Match Drill:
Which feature allows you to replace a specific value in a field with another value?
Aliases change the underlying data in the data source.
The _____ feature allows you to rename field members (e.g., 'M' to 'Male').
Rearrange Alias:
Which calculation computes the difference between two date fields in months?
DATEADD('day', 7, [Date]) adds 7 days to the date.
The _____ function allows you to construct a date from year, month, and day integers.
Match Date Math:
Which visual allows you to see the correlation between two numeric variables?
A Trend Line in a Scatter Plot shows the general direction of the data.
The _____ value (R-Squared) indicates how well the trend line fits the data.
Rearrange Scatter:
Which logical function allows you to test multiple conditions?
AND / OR operators are used to combine multiple conditions in an IF statement.
The _____ function returns true if the current user matches the specified string.
Match Logic Ops:
Which data type represents a True or False value?
Boolean fields can be used on the Color shelf to separate data into True/False colors.
The symbol 'T|F' represents a _____ data type.
Rearrange Boolean:
Which feature allows you to replace a specific field in all views?
You can duplicate a field to create a copy for modification (e.g., binning differently).
The _____ pane displays all the fields in your data source.
Match Field Ops:
Which chart type shows the cumulative sum of a measure represented as a filled area?
A Stacked Area chart shows the total value as well as the breakdown by category.
The _____ chart is a variation of a pie chart with a hole in the center.
Rearrange Area:
Which function is used to convert an integer to a string format with leading zeros?
o: No direct function (use STR plus logic or formatting)

q: You can use the Custom Number format '00000' to display leading zeros.
The _____ function returns the ASCII code of the first character in a string.
Match Formatting:
Which LOD expression creates a calculation that depends on the view granularity?
Standard aggregations (SUM, AVG) always calculate at the view level of detail.
The _____ aggregation allows you to aggregate at the data source level.
Rearrange Agg Level:
Which feature allows you to unite multiple sheets into a single long dashboard for scrolling?
You can set the dashboard height to a large pixel value to enable scrolling.
The _____ layout option ensures dashboard elements resize proportionally.
Match Dash Size:
Which function allows you to calculate the rank of a measure within a partition?
RANK_DENSE returns ranks like 1, 2, 2, 3 (no gaps).
The _____ function returns the ranking as a percentile (0 to 1).
Rearrange Rank:
Which map feature allows you to use your own image as a map?
Background Images require specifying X and Y coordinates to map data points.
The _____ menu allows you to add Background Images.
Match Custom Map:
Which function returns the number of items in a group?
SIZE() returns the number of rows in the partition (table calc).
The _____ function returns the total sum for the partition.
Rearrange Size:
Which feature allows you to see the query generated by Tableau?
You can convert a visual to a crosstab to verify the data.
The _____ Data option allows you to see the underlying rows for a mark.
Match Verification:
Which aggregation allows you to count only unique values?
COUNTD is slower than COUNT because it has to sort/hash values to find uniques.
The _____ aggregation returns the median value.
Rearrange Count Distinct:
Which action allows you to update a set based on user selection in the dashboard?
Set Actions can represent proportional brushing or asymmetric drill-down.
The _____ option in Set Actions defines what happens when the selection is cleared.
Match Set Action:
Which table calculation computes the rolling average over a specified number of periods?
You can configure the moving average to look at the previous N values and the next M values.
The _____ calculation creates a rank based on the values in the view.
Rearrange Moving Avg:
Which feature allows you to define a custom color palette for your visualization?
You must restart Tableau Desktop for changes in Preferences.tps to take effect.
The _____ palette type is used for continuous measures (gradients).
Match Palette:
Which function allows you to execute SQL directly against the data source?
RAWSQL functions are available for all data sources, including Excel.
The _____ function passes a string to the database to be executed as part of the query.
Rearrange RawSQL:
Which feature allows you to show multiple visualization types on a single map layer?
Since 2020.4, you can add unlimited marks layers to a single map visualization.
The _____ feature allows you to offset marks on a map to prevent overlap.
Match Map Advanced:
Which performance recording event indicates rendering the visualization?
A long 'Computing Layout' bar indicates complex dashboard design or too many marks.
The _____ event indicates time spent waiting for the database to return data.
Rearrange Perf Log:
Which function uses a regular expression to extract a substring?
REGEXP_MATCH returns true if the pattern behaves as a match.
The _____ function returns the portion of the string that matches the capturing group.
Match Regex:
Which LOD expression allows you to create a 'Percent of Total' that is not affected by filters?
Using {SUM([Sales])} is a shortcut for FIXED : SUM([Sales]) (Global Total).
To make a dimension filter affect a FIXED LOD, you must add it to _____.
Rearrange LOD Pct:
Which calculation allows you to find the first or last value in a partition?
FIRST() returns 0 for the first row, -1 for the second, etc.
The _____ function returns the index of the current row relative to the last row.
Match Offset:
Which dashboard action can be used to navigate to a different dashboard and filter it?
A Filter Action can target a specific sheet on a different dashboard.
The _____ option ensures that selecting a mark clears the selection on the target sheet.
Rearrange Nav Filter:
Which feature allows you to define custom geographic areas using an external file?
Custom Geocoding extends the built-in geographic roles (e.g., adding custom sales territories).
The _____ file format supports points, lines, and polygons for mapping (e.g., .shp, .kml).
Match Geo File:
Which join calculation allows you to join on a mismatching field type?
You can write a calculation in the Join clause (e.g., INT([Field]) = [ID]).
The _____ operator is used to compare values in a join clause.
Rearrange Join Calc:
Which feature allows you to show a summary of the data in the view?
The Summary Card shows Sum, Avg, Min, Max, and Count for the selected marks.
The _____ feature allows you to show row and column grand totals.
Match Summary:
Which table calculation setting determines how the calculation traverses the table?
Table (Across) computes the calculation across the columns for each row.
The _____ fields are the dimensions that define the scope of the calculation (grouping).
Rearrange Compute:
Which action allows you to navigate to an external resource?
URL Actions can use field values as parameters in the URL query string.
The _____ encoding ensures that special characters in the URL are handled correctly.
Match URL:
Which feature allows you to create users and groups on Tableau Server?
Site Roles (e.g., Viewer, Explorer, Creator) determine what a user can do on the server.
The _____ role allows users to publish new data sources and workbooks.
Which feature allows you to extend dashboard functionality using web applications?
Dashboard Extensions run in the dashboard and can interact with other dashboard objects.
The _____ Gallery is where you can find and download third-party dashboard extensions.
Match Extension:
Which feature animates mark transactions when you filter or sort?
Viz Animations are enabled by default for all new workbooks.
The _____ setting allows you to control the duration of the animation (e.g., 0.5s).
Rearrange Animation:
Which AI feature allows you to select a mark and see statistical explanations for its value?
Explain Data proposes possible explanations for outliers based on statistical models.
The _____ icon appears in the tooltip when Explanations are available.
Match AI Feature:
Which feature allows you to query your data using natural language?
Ask Data allows you to type questions like 'sum of sales by region' to create a viz.
The _____ lens allows you to curate fields and synonyms for Ask Data.
Rearrange Ask Data:
Which feature allows a parameter's list of values to update automatically when the data changes?
You can set a parameter's current value to default to the result of a calculation.
The _____ workbook opens option in the Parameter Edit dialog enables dynamic updates.
Match Parameter Update:
Which tool cleans up messy data (e.g., merged cells, pre-headers) in the Data Source page?
Data Interpreter can remove null rows and merged headers automatically.
The _____ option highlights the changes made by the Data Interpreter in an Excel file.
Match Data Prep:
Which wildcard character allows you to match any character sequence in a filter?
o: * (Asterisk) - In some contexts, but 'Contains' is the standard filter type

q: A Wildcard Match filter allows users to type text to filter string fields.
The _____ filter option is case-insensitive by default in Tableau.
Rearrange Pivot:
Which option allows you to write your own SQL query to define a data connection?
Custom SQL performance is generally faster than using the visual join canvas.
To use parameters in Custom SQL, you use the _____ button.
Match Connection:
Which feature allows you to run SQL commands (e.g., Create Temp Table) when a connection opens?
Initial SQL is useful for setting up temporary tables or session variables.
The _____ SQL cannot return a result set to be used as a data source table.
Rearrange Initial SQL:
Why are Context Filters beneficial for performance?
o: They reduce the amount of data processed by subsequent filters and calculations

q: Context filters are applied before FIXED LOD expressions.
To add a filter to context, right-click the pill and select _____.
Match Filter Perf:
Which Tableau engine is used for High-Performance Extracts?
Hyper extracts (.hyper) replaced the legacy TDE format for better performance.
The _____ file extension represents a Hyper extract.
Rearrange Extract:
Which analytics extension allows you to run Python scripts in calculations?
SCRIPT_REAL returns a numeric result from an external script.
The _____ function is used to run R scripts returns a boolean result.
Match External Service:
Which aggregation error is common when mixing aggregated and non-aggregated fields?
o: Cannot mix aggregate and non-aggregate arguments

q: To fix mixing errors, you can wrap the non-aggregated field in a function like MIN(), MAX(), or ATTR().
Which feature allows you to perform a table calculation on the result of another table calculation?
You can configure independent 'Compute Using' settings for each calculation in a nested table calc.
The _____ Table Calculation allows you to customize the order and addressing of multiple dimensions.
Match Table Calc:
Which analytics feature predicts future data based on historical trends?
Tableau uses exponential smoothing models for forecasting.
The _____ Interval confidence band (e.g., 95%) shows the range of probable values.
Rearrange Forecast:
Which feature groups similar data points together based on selected variables?
Tableau uses the K-Means algorithm for clustering.
The _____ Description describes the statistical attributes of each cluster.
Match Analytics:
Which LOD expression creates a dependency on another LOD expression?
{FIXED [Region] : MAX({FIXED [State] : SUM([Sales])})} finds the max state sales per region.
The _____ context determines if a filter affects the LOD expression.
Rearrange Nested LOD:
Which feature restricts data access based on the logged-in user?
You can use the USERNAME() function in a calculated field to implement RLS.
The _____ Filter option allows you to manually map users to values for RLS.
Match Security:
Which dashboard feature allows you to create specific designs for mobile devices?
Tableau automatically creates a default phone layout for new dashboards.
The _____ Model allows you to preview how the dashboard looks on different devices.
Rearrange Layout:
Which feature allows you to create a guided narrative with a sequence of visualizations?
Each Story Point can contain a different snapshot or state of a dashboard/sheet.
The _____ box allows you to add text descriptions to story points.
Match Story:
Which feature allows you to connect to web data sources like Facebook or Google Sheets?
Web Data Connectors are typically written in HTML and JavaScript.
The _____ version of WDC (e.g., 2.0, 3.0) determines capabilities and compatibility.
Rearrange WDC:
Which limitation applies to Cube (Multidimensional) data sources in Tableau?
You can write MDX (MultiDimensional eXpressions) to create calculated members in Cubes.
The _____ function is used to create a set from a cube.
Match Cubes:
Which action makes a workbook available to others via Tableau Server/Online?
Embedding credentials ensures users don't have to log in to the database to view the report.
The _____ checkbox controls whether the published workbook includes tabs for sheets.
Rearrange Publish:
Which server feature sends an email with a snapshot of a view at regular intervals?
Subscriptions can be set to run only when data extracts are refreshed.
The _____ format allows you to receive the view as a PDF or Image in the email.
Match Server Feature:
Which feature sends an email when a specific mark crosses a threshold?
You must select a continuous numeric axis to create an alert.
The _____ condition defines when the alert is triggered (e.g., Above, Below).
Rearrange Alerts:
How can a Curator improve the Ask Data experience?
o: By adding synonyms and definitions to fields

q: Lenses in Ask Data allow you to create subsets of fields relevant to specific user groups.
Which file type allows you to save a workbook with all its data (packaged workbook)?
A .twb file contains the metadata and visualization definitions but not the actual data.
The _____ file type allows you to save just the data connection information.
Match File Type:
How can you insert the value of a parameter into a dashboard title?
Dashboard titles can be dynamic and update based on filter selections or parameters.
The _____ menu in the text editor allows you to add dynamic fields.
Rearrange Title:
Which separate Tableau tool is designed specifically for visual data preparation (ETL)?
Tableau Prep flows can output data to both Hyper extracts and database tables.
The _____ step in Tableau Prep allows you to clean, filter, and rename fields.
Match Prep Step:
Which technique allows you to use a parameter to toggle between different sheets in a dashboard container?
For sheet swapping to work, you must hide the titles of the sheets involved.
The sheets in a sheet swap must be placed inside a _____ container.
Rearrange Swap:
Which analytics object creates a shaded area behind marks to indicate a range of values?
A Reference Band requires two values (From and To) to define the shaded area.
The _____ Line creates a line at a specific constant or computed value.
Match Ref Line:
Which protocol allows Tableau to connect to map servers for custom background maps?
You can change the washout of a WMS background map in the Map Layers pane.
The _____ Service allows you to use Mapbox vectors for background maps.
Rearrange Map Service:
Which function converts null values to zero?
ZN([Sales]) returns [Sales] if it's not null, otherwise returns 0.
The _____ function returns true if the expression is null.
Rearrange ZN:
Which filter is applied first in the Order of Operations?
Table Calculations are computed after Dimension Filters are applied.
The _____ filter is applied after Context Filters but before Dimension Filters.
Match Order:
Which union method allows you to combine files from a folder based on a pattern?
Wildcard Union can automatically include new files added to the folder that match the pattern.
The _____ field in a union identifies which file/table the row came from.
Rearrange Union:
Which action allows you to dim unselected marks to focus on selected ones?
Highlight actions do not remove data from the view, they only change visual emphasis.
You can highlight marks using the _____ Legend.
Match Highlight:
Which feature allows you to display a visualization inside another visualization's tooltip?
Viz in Tooltip automatically filters the target viz based on the mark hovered over.
The _____ element is used in the tooltip editor to reference another sheet.
Rearrange Tooltip:
In the new Data Model (2020.2+), what is the relationship layer called?
The Physical Layer is where you define Joins and Unions.
Relationships (Noodles) are defined in the _____ Layer.
Match Layers:
Which keyword is NOT a valid LOD keyword?
FIXED can be used without any dimensions to calculate a global aggregate.
Which Tableau Server process is responsible for loading and rendering views?
The VizQL Server process converts requests from the client into SQL queries and renders the results.
The _____ process manages the refresh of scheduled extracts and subscriptions.
Match Server Process:
Which performance optimization technique allows Tableau to combine multiple queries into a single query?
Query Fusion only works if the queries have the same level of detail and filter set.
The _____ feature allows Tableau to execute multiple independent queries simultaneously.
Rearrange Fusion:
Which Javascript API / Embedding API method allows you to apply a filter to a visualization programmatically?
All asynchronous methods in the Javascript API return a Promise.
The _____ API v3 is the modern replacement for the legacy Javascript API.
Rearrange JS API:
Which feature allows you to control the visibility of dashboard zones (containers) using a field or parameter?
Dynamic Zone Visibility creates a space reservation even when the object is hidden.
To use Dynamic Zone Visibility, the controlling field must be a _____ or a boolean parameter.
Match Zone Vis:
Which spatial function creates a circular area around a point?
MAKELINE(Start, End) creates a great elliptic arc between two points.
The _____ function creates a spatial point from latitude and longitude.
Rearrange Buffer:
Which Data Management feature allows you to see the lineage and impact analysis of your data?
Tableau Catalog automatically indexes metadata from all content on the server.
The _____ Analysis view shows which workbooks differ if a column is changed.
Match Data Mgmt:
Which Server Management Add-on tool allows you to monitor the health and performance of the server?
The Content Migration Tool allows you to script the promotion of content between environments (Dev -> Prod).
The _____ Gateway process routes traffic to the appropriate server node.
Match Server Mgmt:
Which authentication protocol allows for Single Sign-On (SSO) using an Identity Provider (IdP)?
Kerberos can be used for seamless single sign-on in a Windows environment.
The _____ protocol is an open standard for authentication used by Google/Facebook logins.
Match Auth:
Which feature allows you to schedule and monitor Tableau Prep flows on the server?
Prep Conductor is part of the Data Management Add-on.
A _____ allows you to combine connection details and credentials for multiple tables.
Rearrange Conductor:
Which field role allows Tableau to dynamically render images from URLs in headers?
To use Image Role, the field must contain valid URLs pointing to images (png/jpg).
Image Role fields must be of the _____ data type.
Match Image Role:
Which function converts a string to proper case (Title Case)?
PROPER('tableau desktop') returns 'Tableau Desktop'.
The _____ function removes leading and trailing whitespace.
Rearrange String:
Which feature allows you to track a key data point from any dashboard in a simplified view?
Metrics automatically update when the underlying data is refreshed.
Tableau Pulse provides personalized _____ about your metrics.
Match Metrics:
Which feature allows you to organize content from different projects into a single list?
Adding content to a Collection moves it from its original location.
Which tool is used to configure, manage, and monitor the Tableau Server configuration (e.g., ports, authentication)?
You can access TSM via a web interface or a command-line interface (CLI).
The _____ command is used to apply pending configuration changes in TSM.
Match TSM:
Which pre-built dashboard allows admins to see which views are most popular on the server?
The 'Background Tasks for Extracts' view shows success/failure of extract refreshes.
The _____ repository database creates the data for the admin views.
Rearrange Admin:
Which authentication method establishes a trusted relationship between Tableau and an external application (JWT based)?
Connected Apps allow for seamless embedding without requiring third-party cookies (unlike Trusted Tickets).
Connected Apps use _____ tokens to sign the requests.
Match Auth Method:
Which accessibility feature allows screen readers to describe a visualization?
You can add Alt Text via the Accessibility option in the Worksheet menu.
The _____ focus order determines the sequence in which screen readers read dashboard objects.
Rearrange Access:
Which feature allows you to use published data sources programmatically via an API?
VizQL Data Service allows external applications to query published data models without rendering a viz.
VizQL Data Service is part of the _____ Developer Platform.
Match Data Access:
Which component allows you to integrate Salesforce Einstein predictions directly into a dashboard?
You can use the MODEL_QUANTILE table calculation to bring predictions from Einstein Discovery.
The _____ calculation allows you to get a single prediction value for a row.
Rearrange Einstein:
How do Virtual Connections handle Row-Level Security?
A Data Policy in a Virtual Connection applies to all tables in that connection.
The _____ Mode in Virtual Connections allows you to enforce security policies.
Match VConn:
Which feature provides a private sandbox for users to save content before publishing it widely?
Content in Personal Space is invisible to other users, including admins (mostly).
Admins can limit the _____ usage of Personal Spaces to prevent server overload.
Rearrange Space:
Which data shape is best for analysis in Tableau?
Wide data (many columns for time periods) should typically be pivoted to Tall data.
The _____ operation transforms wide data into tall data.
Match Shaping:
Which sort option allows you to sort a dimension based on the values of another field within a pane?
A Nested Sort respects the hierarchy and context of the pane.
The _____ button on the axis performs a nested sort by default.
Rearrange Sort:
Which shelf allows you to create a flipbook-style animation of your data?
The Pages Shelf works best with date or numeric fields.
The _____ History option allows you to see the trail of marks as they move.
Rearrange Pages:
Which map type aggregates points into hexagonal bins to show density?
You typically use the HEXBINX and HEXBINY functions to create a hexbin map.
The _____ map type uses color intensity to show the concentration of points.
Match Density Map:
Which chart type is used to visualize the flow of data from one set of values to another?
Creating a Sankey diagram in Tableau typically requires data densification (e.g., Unioning data).
Which text function is used to pass a string variable to an R or Python script?
Tableau sends data to R/Python as a list of vectors.
The _____ function allows you to return a string result from an external script.
Match Scripting:
In a Performance Recording, what does a long 'Computing Layout' bar typically indicate?
o: Too many marks or complex dashboard design

q: Filtering data early in the query pipeline improves performance.
The _____ Dashboard command in the Help menu starts the performance recording.
Rearrange Perf:
Which table in the Tableau Server Repository contains information about workbook views?
You need the 'readonly' user password to connect to the Tableau Server Repository.
The _____ table contains the history of all user actions on the server.
Match Tables:
What happens to High Priority subscriptions if the server is overloaded?
o: They are prioritized over normal subscriptions

q: You can subscribe other users to a view if you have the permission.
The _____ Image option in subscriptions adds the view as an image in the email body.
Rearrange Sub:
How can admins see how users are interacting with Ask Data?
Ask Data allows users to save their queries as a new workbook.
The _____ allows admins to see which fields are most frequently queried.
Match Ask Data:
Which feature allows Tableau Mobile users to see data without an internet connection?
Tableau Mobile supports biometric authentication (FaceID/TouchID).
The _____ Layout is automatically used when viewing on a phone.
Rearrange Mobile:
Which capability is NOT fully supported in Web Authoring compared to Desktop (as of recent versions)?
o: Creating new extracts (from scratch) or heavy data modeling

q: Web Authoring allows you to edit existing workbooks and save them.
The _____ button allows you to switch from viewing to editing mode in the browser.
Match Web Edit:
How can you restore a previous version of a workbook on Tableau Server?
Revision History limits can be configured by the server administrator.
The _____ option in the Action menu allows you to download a previous revision.
Rearrange Rev:
Which tool analyzes your workbook and suggests performance improvements before publishing?
Workbook Optimizer runs automatically when you publish a workbook.
The _____ category in Workbook Optimizer indicates changes that will improve performance.
